TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit PrintStringProperty extends System.Printing.IndexedProperties.PrintProperty

Docs.summary: Represents a property (and its value) of a printing system hardware or software component.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this class to install a second printer that differs in its properties from an existing printer only in location, port, and shared status.
[!code-csharp[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/CSharp/Program.cs#cloneprinter)] [!code-vb[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/visualbasic/program.vb#cloneprinter)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string attributeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property that the represents.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `attributeName` should be spelled exactly the same as the name of some particular <xref:System.String> property of a print system object, including casing. For example, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemJobInfo.Submitter%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemJobInfo> object must be spelled "Submitter", not "submitter".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string attributeName, object attributeValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property that the represents.
The value of the property that the represents.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that has the specified value for the specified property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `attributeName` should be spelled exactly the same as the name of some particular <xref:System.String> property of a print system object, including casing. For example, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemJobInfo.Submitter%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemJobInfo> object must be spelled "Submitter", not "submitter".
## Examples The following example shows how to use this constructor to install a second printer that differs in its properties from an existing printer only in location, port, and shared status.
[!code-csharp[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/CSharp/Program.cs#cloneprinter)] [!code-vb[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/visualbasic/program.vb#cloneprinter)]
